Text.Value: If we can find it, perhaps we can use it to destroy Ketheric.
Its powers could prove useful. Especially if turned against Ketheric himself.
If we find it, we might turn it against him.
Sounds powerful, no matter the name. If we find it, we can turn it against him.
If we find it, we can use it against Thorm, perhaps.
Maybe we can turn it against Ketheric. Or destroy it.
Perhaps there is a way to turn it against Ketheric Thorm.
If we find it, maybe we can turn it against him?
Assuming we can find it. Anything that powerful will be protected.
First, we have to find it. And I suspect he keeps it very, very well hidden.
We'll need to explore thoroughly. I doubt Ketheric leaves the means to his downfall out in the open.
Then we better get searching. Shall we?
We'd need to find it, first of all. No simple feat.
Let's get looking. Something that valuable won't be easy to reach.
It must be found, first of all. No easy feat.
If we find it. I doubt he's just left it lying around.
So, the Nightsong is key to Ketheric's invulnerability.
This 'Nightsong' is the source of Ketheric's invulnerability.
The Nightsong must be the source of Ketheric's life force.
This 'Nightsong' sounds like the source of Ketheric Thorm's invulnerability.
Ketheric's power must stem from the Nightsong.
So the Nightsong is the key to taking Ketheric down.
The Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric Thorm's invulnerability.
This Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric's immortality.
Curious name. It sounds more like a bird than a font of power.
An evocative name. More suited to poetry than the Absolute's perversions.
'Nightsong'. An appropriate name for an owl, perhaps - but not for a cult artefact.
'Nightsong.' A tender name for a cultist artefact.
That name... not the first thing you'd think to call an artefact of the Absolute.
Nice name. Wonder if it's a music box or something.
The very same Nightsong that Aradin once sought. What could it be?
'Nightsong' - not exactly a name I'd associate with the Absolute.
So, the Nightsong is key to Ketheric's power. If we can find it, perhaps we can use it against him.
So, the 'Nightsong' is the source of Ketheric's invulnerability. Perhaps its powers could be turned against him.
The Nightsong is the source of Ketheric's life force. Which means it could be turned against him.
This 'Nightsong' must be the source of Ketheric Thorm's invulnerability. But perhaps it could be turned against him.
The Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric's immortality. I wager it would be used against him.
This Nightsong must be the key to taking Ketheric down. Now we know what we're looking for.
The Nightsong must be the source of Thorm's invulnerability. Perhaps it can be turned against him.
This Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric's immortality. Maybe I can use it against him?
Assuming we can find it. Anything that powerful will be protected.
First, we have to find it. And I suspect he keeps it very, very well hidden.
We'll need to explore thoroughly. I doubt Ketheric leaves the means to his downfall out in the open.
Then we better get searching. Shall we?
Finding it may be easier said than done.
First we need to find it. Something that valuable won't be sitting on a shelf somewhere.
It must be found, first of all. No easy task.
If we find it. I doubt he's just left it lying around.
Assuming we can find it. Anything that powerful will be protected.
First, we have to find it. And I suspect he keeps it very, very well hidden.
We'll need to explore thoroughly. I doubt Ketheric leaves the means to his downfall out in the open.
Then we better get searching. Shall we?
We'd have to find it, first of all. Doesn't sound easy.
Won't be hard to get at, but we should get cracking.
Finding it may not be a simple matter.
We have to find it first. I doubt he's just left it lying around.
If we can find it, perhaps we can use it to destroy him.
Its powers could prove useful. Especially if turned against Ketheric himself.
If we find it, we might turn it against him.
If we find it, we can turn it against him.
Something that powerful could be turned against Thorm.
Might be possible to turn it against him - or destroy it.
Perhaps there is a way to turn its power against Ketheric Thorm.
If we find it, maybe we can turn it against him?

Synopsis: The player has read the book detailing the source of Ketheric's invulnrability found in Balthazar's secret room. It's still not clear what the Nightsong is, but it clearly provides immense power.
